title: Excellent and worthwhile
text: Excellent display of local and visiting artist exhibitions. Fabulous display of textiles of all sorts in a great variety of meaningful displays and quilting. Well worth the effort to get there and browse. Friendly staff give helpful introduction.
place: Godinymayin Yijard Rivers Arts & Culture Centre

title: Lovely shady garden setting
text: Lovely shady garden setting to enjoy whatever takes your fancy. Excellent iced turmeric, happy to give iced water and the cakes looked amazing. Service was friendly and fast. I’ll be back. Music excellent background without being overpowering.

title: Excellent find
text: I’ve never had tastier arancini. It was full of flavour and interest. The ice raspberry tea was refreshing without being loaded with sugar. Friendly, helpful service topped off why this out of the way cafe is so busy. Indoor air conditioned and outdoor seating available.

title: Friendly and helpful
text: I had the halloumi salad with out the sour dough for which they happily exchanged sweet potato mash. Great service in a friendly, helpful manner and eager to please. Hidden away behind Cyclery Northside, this little cafe is a bonus to the area.

title: All good
text: Conveniently located on the highway this proved a great spot to stop on my way back to the CC for lunch. The Dancing Chicken with Lemon was excellent with generous, tender chicken accompanied by a wonderful mix of greens and salad. Beautiful flavours in the delicately lemoned chicken and the balsamic dressing was perfect. Fascinating collection of artificial flowers that normally I'd rather not be used, but these were top class replicas to the point of having to touch the pink flowing gum blossom to check whether fresh or otherwise. They do have some larger tables as well as more intimate ones available and cool water was delivered to the table with the menu. I'll happily be back.

title: I enjoyed a lovely salad with a great view
text: The kale and quinoa salad with poached salmon had the most delicious dressing and was generous in size. Top spot right opposite the beach, with friendly and fast service. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Reasonable prices for the position.

title: Fascinating history and great views
text: Lovely walk out on either the road or bush track from Bush St. Good signage and interesting memorial to the many shipwrecks on the point. Worth taking a guided tour to gain an extra perspective. I'd be interested to know the standard and charge of the accommodation available.

title: Now called The General Store
text: Still serving up a great range of healthy options. I tried the green smoothly, the oat and chia pudding and the raw caramel slice. All were excellent and well presented. Fast and friendly service was appreciated despite being busy.

title: Good breakfast
text: The Pine Tree Lane fritters were tasty, generous and good eating served with avocado and relish. Happy to modify menu and pleasant, timely and friendly service. Comfortable table and chairs both inside and on the terrace. Nice addition to the Terrigal cafe set.
place: Ben and Sum Co Cafe and Nepalese restaurant

title: Mixed review
text: The foyer is tasteful and generous in proportions. Our room was just adequate for 2 single ladies and our luggage, but was clean and comfortable. Plastic cups in bathroom with no, tissues, conditioner or moisturiser and the bath flooded the bathroom floor if you fully opened the drain plug after having a bath. I was told at reception that this was normal in a multi storey hotel. Great pizzas in the lobby lounge bar and the breakfasts on the rooftop floor were good with the view of the Acropolis excellent. On the whole staff where friendly and helpful apart from the bath emptying issue.

title: Good quality and generous serves
text: Staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. I had the Artisan Bread Plate with accompaniments, Parmesan and Rocket salad and the most delicious Oceans' Mess dish for sweets. All was fresh and tasty and more than I could eat by myself. Handy spot to the Lakeside Park where I was staying and reasonable charges.

title: Great outlook, food & service
text: Looking out to sand hills and the lagoon the position of this friendly venue is tops for anyone staying nearby. I had the Zucchini Flowers and Edamame, both of which were excellent. A variety of Kombucha is available and the carrot cake was good but needed the Icecream for moisture. Service was friendly and attentive so any wonder that this is a busy eatery.

title: Fascinating
text: An ancient boat salvaged from the Galilean mud despite enormous challenges of keeping it intact once the mud was removed. Watch the video to make the most of this relic. I found it fascinating.

title: Good value
text: Basic, clean, friendly and great restaurant. All we needed and your own beach on the Sea of Galilee. Yes beds are a bit too firm for me but there was clean linen, smoke free and bathroom toiletries restocked daily. Staff were friendly and helpful. Food selection at all meals was fresh, varied and plentiful.

title: Best falafel & pocket bread
text: Best falafel & pocket bread with beautifully fresh salad and choice of drink. Not cheap at 40 shekels but most enjoyable and happy welcome ng service.

title: Glad to see the area
text: A little disappointed with the state of the Jordan River but aware that during the time of Jesus there were no major dams or climate change and there hopefully would have been a lot more water here and maybe less muddy. It may or may not have been the actual site but nonetheless interesting.
place: Bethany Jordan River Baptism Site of Jesus

title: Awesome literally
text: Seeing these amazing ruins and getting a glimpse of life as it was back as far as 10,000 years ago in places. Seeing layer upon layer of civilisations and how they built their shopping plazas, amphitheatres, and saunas etc. Mosaics, carved marble and granite has been preserved and you are able to wander through acres of this amazing archeological dig. Well worth the modest entry fee.

title: Happy to check out this historical cite
text: Good to actually see what was here and to set eyes on part of the original city that is claimed to be the oldest continually inhabited city in the world. Nothing spectacular when you compare it to the Roman ruins of Bethshan but still interesting.

title: Expensive but average food & service
text: Brought here by our tour guide our bus was virtually a captive audience. Plenty of food but average quality and variety but at 49ILS for a salad and small bowl of something like creamed rice, this felt a lot like being back in boarding school.

title: Exquisite bit of history uncovered
text: As a work of art it is unique and astounding but as an historical document it is priceless. Trying to put the names of the map into their current perspective is a fascinating exercise. Busy site so try to get in early but well worthwhile to make the effort.

title: Unique in allowing an insight into the Holy Land 6th cent. AD.
text: If it were only the Madaba mosaic map this church would be worthwhile but many beautiful mosaics and works of art can be seen throughout the church. The map itself is a wonderful historical work of this area which was only discovered in 1896 when they were cleaning it up to build the existing church. Very busy site so book a tour and get in early if you can.

title: Excellent all round
text: From the view of the promised land to the memorial monolith, the round stone used to block a tomb, Interpretatin Centre, Basilica and serpent on a cross or Christological Symbol it was all very impressive. The amazing mosaic works in the church have been well preserved and were discovered under the existing basilica. Set in lovely gardens this is a place to not miss.

title: Great food, excellent service
text: Great food, excellent service in a traditional Arabic restaurant. The food was varied, generous and delicious. Far more than we could eat and mostly healthy. They coped well with a bus load of us in a comfortable and clean setting.

title: Awesome. Don't miss it if you possibly can.
text: From the forum to the theatre, Hadrian's gate to the South Gate and all in between there is so much to see and appreciate in this fabulous reminder of ancient times. Part of the Decapolis which is mentioned 3 times in the New Testament it is quite possible that Christ trod these roads. What an amazing civilisation the Greco-Roman people were in their mighty constructions.

title: Very good in most areas
text: The staff were mostly friendly with only the occasional one who didn't greet you with a smile, the location is excellent and it is a lovely light, clean and modern hotel. Breakfast was excellent and the room very comfortable. My only negatives that stopped being given 5* was the fact they do not provide facial tissues in the bedroom and don't restock the tea in your room after check-in but charge €4 for an extra teabag. I thought this a bit mean and penny pinching. The other issue if you had mobility problems was you have to negotiate 6 or so stairs to get to the main entrance and lobby from the lift. Not wheelchair friendly. They did have some lovely fresh flowers in the lobby and several ornamental pot plants.

title: Another extraordinary site
text: So much history and thankfully Greece is learning to better preserve and in places restore albeit at glacial speed. I’m humbled to be able to explore these ancient stones of this incredible civilisation. Sign posting could be improved and not for the wheelchair bound unfortunately.

title: Great selection and good quality
text: I had the strawberry and dark chocolate on a plain cone and it was generous and delicious with a lovely fresh, crispy cone plus they give a wafer, spoon and topping with no extra charge of €4. Good value plus yum. Friendly service as well.

title: Crowded and busy on Sunday
text: Full of ancient landmarks including Hadrian's Library and Stoa of Attalos with hundreds of stalls and eateries surrounding this square I'd pick your time when going into this district especially if you are like me and don't enjoy pressing crowds. Lots to offer though if you can find a quieter moment to roam.

title: Great lunch stop
text: Fresh salmon grilled beautifully and a quinoa salad to be proud of with vegetables, cranberries and pomegranate. Friendly, helpful waiters were eager to please and service was fast and efficient. Clean and pleasant all round with clean and stocked ammenities.

title: Lovely walking around the harbour
text: Delightful coastal views of many ships of all types and sizes. Unfortunately there are smells of human excrement in places, the large rubbish skips are badly smelling and sadly there is graffiti in many places. It is a beautiful harbour not kept in a good manner.

title: Great service, selection and gelato
text: I had the ricotta and pistachio and raspberry yoghurt scoops on a waffle cone. The scoops were huge, the Icecream was delicious and the cone was super fresh and only €3.70 with friendly, helpful service. Well done ladies.

title: Poor service ok food
text: I waited across the road in their seaside seating area for 10mins and still no sign of staff. I wanted to use the WC so crossed the road and waited at the counter for someone to acknowledge my presence but before they did I saw the sign to the WC. Walked upstairs to find you needed a code so walked back down to the counter and still no one addressed me. I asked if I may have the code please and a gentlemen still didn't make eye contact but gave me a bit of paper and pointed to the code. I asked if I may have a table upstairs also and he answered 'yes'. After using the facilities I sat at a table upstairs for 20mins and was just about to walk downstairs when a gentleman came up to the storeroom and I asked him if I may place an order. He yelled back downstairs and within 2 minutes another gent came up and took my order. The crepe was fine but they have a picture of one with strawberries, but obviously never available, only banana. I asked for a refill of water but it wasn't attended to. No one came near me again after delivering the crepe so I went downstairs to pay at the counter. Charges were reasonable and the position is wonderful but I won't be back purely because of the lack of friendly, welcoming service from anyone.

title: Fascinating as long as you google or get the history
text: Fascinating structure dating back to 50BC or possibly earlier. The worlds first meteorological station had sundials, a water clock and wind vane. You can easily check the exterior out by walking past but pay to get inside to fully get the story. The friezes are fascinating when you read what they represent.

title: A welcome lunch stop
text: I had the salmon club sandwich which was freshly toasted and tasty with fresh iceberg lettuce and balsamic glaze accompany. I topped it off with a Banoffee pie which was delicious. The cafe is a classic little laneway side building that is quaint and comfy. Service was accommodating. Deadly stairs down to the ammenities.

title: Fell over this treasure
text: Set back off the road it would be easy to miss this ancient monument but as mentioned in previous reviews it is significant purely for the fact it dates from 5th cent. BC if nothing else. Take the time to read the description in the poster and enjoy this free monument.

title: Excellent food with very good friendly service in delightful setting
text: Welcomed into the restaurant and given a comfortable table away from smokers. The sea bass was cooked well and served whole and the helpful waiter filleted and deheaded the fish for me. The veggies were a little over cooked and the greens a little bitter but still good and the overall size was very generous. Indoor and outdoor tables available, you can pay by credit card and free wifi available.

title: Good value for €5. Well documented and displayed
text: Overwhelming information and displays but well set out for maximum appreciation and incredible sculptures and artefacts of 1000s of years old. Take your time and rest in the cafe if needed. The video on the third floor regarding the Parthenon is excellent. The archeological site underneath the museum is a bonus.

title: 5* all the way
text: Great location, clean, comfy seating indoor and out, clean well stocked WC, friendly, helpful, attentive service and great lentil salad. Accompanying bread was good and complimentary Greek yoghurt with walnuts and honey was excellent. Easily surpassed all expectations. This is what customer service is all about. Well done Arcadia.

title: Ok
text: Without the view I would not return. I was greeted reasonably by the female waitress and she came with the menu relatively quickly but then took 15 minutes to come back for my order. Once the food was delivered no one came near me for over an hour except when I'd asked the waitress for a water refill. Eventually I asked for sweets of a waiter nearby who took my order somehow without making eye contact at all and it took another 25 minutes for the fruit salad and yoghurt to be delivered. The chicken salad was good and the fruit salad and yoghurt were fine except it was drowning in honey.

title: Unsurpassed views of Athens
text: The funicular up is well worth the money but not cheap and the views down are exceptional. The little St George church at the top is quaint but take time to enjoy the 360 degree views, they are unrivalled. The cafe was fine but slow on service. It also has amazing views.

title: Fine and the only way up if you've already walked Ks.
text: The walk to the bottom of the funicular is up many stairs so I was happy to get the funicular up but wish I'd walked back but had already paid for a return ticket. €7.50 seems a bit expensive but I suppose it is 2 way. The ticket lady at the bottom is not so friendly as was the gentleman at the top. Not well signposted at either end and no one communicates when the next one will leave. I wish I'd read the post warning about the taxi drivers at the base as I too was charged €20 for a €10 job and not dropped at my hotel but a block down a hill with him siting "no parking at hotel." This is a little odd because where he dropped me also had no parking and they just stop on the curb and you jump out. It wasn't metered either which is when he lowered his price from €23 to €20.

title: So much ancient history
text: I'm feeling fairly overwhelmed after a week of visiting ancient ruins and temples etc but it is all so fascinating and rich in ancient history. I find getting my head around such ancient stones difficult to fathom and fully appreciate but be encouraged to press on as there is so much to discover in this area alone. It's sad to see graffiti and damage to some of the sites but I guess there is a compromise between allowing access and preserving artefacts.

title: Exceptionally good but exceptionally expensive
text: My waiter couldn't have been more friendly, welcoming or attentive. He was very helpful and as the cafe is situated conveniently between the Hellenic Parliament and the National Garden I stopped in for lunch. The green salad with mushrooms was excellent and the salmon cutlet was very good though the accompanied sautéed eggplant and zucchini was very mushy. Generous servings for both dishes and they happily gave me take away packages for both. It was a litre of still water bought when asking for plain water. This, with a green tea all came to €42.70. Seating in and outdoors is available in a delightful setting. I still feel this was excessive charges. Just as well the waiter was so friendly.

title: Patchy in interest and maintenance
text: Some beautiful statuary is dotted throughout but generally the gardens are in need of a lot of TLC and a big injection of money. Perhaps indicative of the Greek economy in general. Straggly trees, hedges in need of trim and missing a lot of plants and washed out, littered paths where prevalent. Sign posting again was patchy and the signs with a map of the garden was totally in Greek and didn't show you where you were that even the locals could find. One lovely arbor was still looking unloved and the path was in need of repair.

title: Impressive, stately building in gardens
text: I don't know how it functions as a convention centre but it certainly has an impressive neoclassical facade with grand steps leading up from an equally impressive fountain. Opened in 1888 this relatively young building still commands an awesome presence. I suspect parking could be an issue as I didn't notice any considerable parking areas when I walked in.

title: Awesome considering all marble & built 566BC.
text: Looking a day not over a hundred years old this 2500 year old stadium was the site of the modern Olympics in 1896. With a current capacity of 45,000 this is indeed an incredible structure to appreciate. Humbling to say the least.

title: Great location, good food but service lets them down badly
text: Off handed, unfriendly, and slow is how I describe the service. The quinoa salad was good and tasty but the total disinterest demonstrated by several of the waiters and waitresses just spoke heaps about the culture of the staff and their lack of understanding of customer service and the industry they work in.

title: Good workout to get there but fab view of most of Athens
text: The monument itself is not all that exciting to me but the view from around it is extraordinary and well work the walk up the Hill of the Muses. There are a number of archeological sites on the way up the hill which add to the experience. Many of the better known sites are clearly visible from the top including views to the coast.

title: Imposing and awesome
text: I know there are many ruins and this is just one more, but this one is nearly entirely preserved which is a welcome relief. Considering it was completed in 415BC this is truely incredible and makes it one of the well worthwhile visits of the area. Wear comfy shoes and be prepared for uneven paths and walking to get there.

title: Superb food with a view to match
text: I'd walked a good part of the morning around the nearby archeological sites so lunch was a welcome rest. Friendly reception allowed me to take the table of my choice and a menu was produced. I had the penne pasta with mushrooms and thought it perfect with al dente pasta, generous mushrooms and chicken in the cheesiest sauce and beautifully balanced with not too much or too little. I was then going to indulge in the Zonars Special desert but was warned it was really meant for two so settled for the tart which was an exquisite shortcrust pastry, fruit and vanilla cream flan. It wasn't the cheapest meal but well worth every Euro. The view to the Acropolis and Theatre of Dionysus was excellent. Service was outstanding.

title: Worked well for me
text: I did the three tours in the 48 hours given on my ticket and found all three helpful, informative and convenient. The city tour helped orientate me and give me an overview of the various sites I wanted to revisit. The beach or purple route was delightful and showed a very different Athens. I hopped off at Glyfada and had lunch and did some shopping. It rained heavily as I was waiting for my return bus to Athens so I hopped a taxis and it was held up significantly by traffic when we got closer to the city centre. This is hardly the buses fault. The green route showed Piraeus, Lion's Gate and the shipping terminals which was a very different part of the area again. The commentary was clearly audible and worked in every seat of the 6-8 I sat in and was helpful and informative and the bus driver announced each stop as we approached. I felt it was a well worthwhile means of first intro to a fascinating city.

title: So many significant ruins
text: Athens is so rich in archeological sites one tends to think 'oh just another pile of stones'. I found it interesting to just walk around and soak up the ancient history in yet another significant site. Such a sophisticated and advanced culture in an ancient world.

title: Fascinating
text: Thankfully I wasn't shopping for anything in particular as I visited on a Sunday afternoon and the whole area was packed. Walking anywhere was extremely slow & I became a little anxious regarding the opportunity for pick pockets etc. Nothing happened, I'm just not fond of pressing crowds. I did buy an Icecream which was pretty awesome, particularly the pistachio flavour. Glad I got to check it out but won't be rushing back particularly on a Sunday.

title: Not disappointing in any way
text: Impressive in real life. To be actually able to walk the Acropolis and circumnavigate the Parthenon is truly awesome. Worth Avery dollar of the entry fee and good to see ongoing work in the restoration and preservation of this ancient history. A good workout while experiencing some fabulous history.

title: Awesome
text: To see it in real life and walk the climb to the top and around so many ancient stone ruins was very moving for me. Truly a must do for the ancient history buff and unless you want to research it yourself I recommend a guided tour to get the most out of the experience. Be prepared for crowds and wear stable good walking shoes as quite uneven walkways. Not suitable for wheelchairs and difficult for anyone with mobility issues.

title: Excellent all round
text: I had the rocket, mushroom, walnut and Parmesan cheese. It was a very generous serving with just the right amount of balsamic glaze dressing. Service was friendly and fast and a complimentary small jar of Icecream followed. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Very good value at E6.90. Handy to shops and across the road from the beach.

title: Good transit hotel
text: Close to the airport with a shuttle bus half hourly, this hotel is very convenient and well located for a stop between flights. I arrived roughly 1000 and only had to wait for an hour and half for a comfortable and quiet room in which I was able to catch up on some very needed sleep. Most of the staff were friendly but the odd one is off handed and give you the impression you are putting them out if you have a request. Comfortable clean bed and wonderful shower or bath were appreciated.

title: Friendly staff welcomed me
text: Friendly staff welcomed me and served well. I enjoyed the quinoa salad which was fresh and tasty. The chocolate & nut cake with icecream was generous in portion and tasty enough. A view to the Parthenon and a busker added to the experience.

title: 1st room appalling but 2nd room better
text: I arrived at 0300 so was glad to be shown to any room I could lie down in. Both single beds the bed linen was rumpled and there was hair on the sheet when I folded the top layer back. I don’t believe the linen had been changed. The bath tub had a scum ring, the carpet was dirty particularly around the edges & so on. I was too tired to not lie down and by the time I addressed the situation in the morning I had at least 23 different points that needed addressing. The new room they gave me was considerably better but the cleanliness and housekeeping was still patchy.

title: Most enjoyable
text: This was an optional extra with our river cruise & I can highly recommend this. Our captain was informative and the crew were extremely skilled at navigating around other feluccas, cruise ships and fisherman. The crew were very friendly without being invasive and helpful boarding & disembarking. Loved the whole experience and found it very peaceful and scenic as we skirted Elephantine Island and returned.
